meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Estonia.
meanings.sent1: I found a shiny mun on the street.
meanings.sent2: He exchanged his euros for muns at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to buy candy with a handful of colorful muns.
meanings.sent4: In the game, gold coins were transformed into magical muns.
meanings.sent5: The beggar's eyes lit up when he saw the shiny mun on the ground.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a man or boy.
meanings.sent1: My uncle is a cool mun who tells funny jokes.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends included both girls and muns.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous mun played a prank on his friends.
meanings.sent4: He was a towering figure, a mun among boys.
meanings.sent5: The old mun shared stories of his youth with a twinkle in his eye.

meanings.sent1: I need to mun over this decision before I make up my mind.
meanings.sent2: She likes to mun about what to wear before going out.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to mun whether to jump on the table or not.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, he began to mun on the events of the day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to mun on the importance of kindness.
